reviews.text:
Didn't announce cancellation of my train, then told me the wrong information so that I missed my next train.
This has to be the worst station in Manchester 
Always late should be the moto

I was walking an old lady who was blind to a train on platform 5.  It was a cross country train.  I helped her up the step onto the train.  With her half way in the train door automatically closed on her knocking her to the ground where she now lay.  A staff member ambled over.  I asked the staff member for help.  The lady eho was blind said she was fine but i thought she was in shock having just been knocked off a train by the train door and was not fine.  I had my own train to catch on a different platform.  I asked the staff member for help and she refused to help.  If i had been knocked from a train and fallen to the ground and not able to see then i would seek reassurance.  I am deeply disappointed by the staff member and the lack of help from another staff member at the barrier.  The station itself is nice but the service today was despicable
Visiting on business. Not a bad station but I prefer Birmingham New St. The people are friendlier there when trying to navigate surroundings.

Gate staff more interested in discussing weekend plans and blocking access to help or let passengers on trains. toilets that smell like someone has been gutting rotting fish. A near constant change of platforms like a dismal game of musical chairs. Avoid at all cost.

A lovely gentleman working helped us find our platform, walked us there and even came back found us on the train  and showed us the route on his phone with time we would be arriving.  Superb service. Thurs. 29th, Aug.
